intro: Brassica oleracea proles viridis, commonly known as green cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact heads of dark green leaves that are tightly folded. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a short, stout stem. Its leaves are succulent and have a slightly bitter taste, which is common in many Brassica species. This variety is widely cultivated for its edible leaves and is an important crop in many regions around the world.
